title: Football club donates 3,000 pies to homeless people after game abandoned
text:
The charity labelled the move ‘a very nice gesture’ (Picture: Nottingham Forest FC)

Nottingham Forest FC has been widely praised for donating 3,000 pies and pasties to homeless people after the club’s game was abandoned.

The Championship side’s match against Reading FC was called off when heavy rain left the City Ground pitch unplayable yesterday.

But instead of letting food bought in for fans go to waste, the club decided to donate pies, pasties and sandwiches to Framework, a homeless charity based in the city.

A representative of the organisation, support planner Ceesay Nfally, praised the club and told Metro.co.uk that the donation was ‘much needed’.

He said: ‘It was a very nice gesture. Food is always welcome.

Pies, pasties and sandwiches were donated (Picture: Nottingham Forest FC)

The club’s Community Trust CEO Graham Moran helped out with the delivery (Picture: Nottingham Forest FC)

The club’s game had been abandoned because of a waterlogged pitch (Picture: Rex)

‘It was because the game was cancelled. The deliveries were much needed… we’ve still got some leftover.’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Fans also backed the move on Twitter.

One, Adie, wrote: ‘Well done all at NFFC! A kind gesture that puts a bit of faith back into human kindness.’

Another, Davo M, said: ‘I love what this club has become – it’s every bit as important as what happens on the pitch as far as I’m concerned.’

Rival fan Paul Spencer added: ‘Credit where it’s due (although I’m a Derby supporter!)… nice gesture from the management at Nottingham Forest donating a lot of food to a great homeless charity.’

Fans backed the move on social media (Picture: Nottingham Forest FC)

Framework said the food was ‘much needed’ (Picture: Nottingham Forest FC)

Nottingham Forest FC did not immediately respond to a request for comment, but the club tweeted that CFO Samantha Gordon and Nottingham Forest Community Trust CEO Graham Moran helped to hand out the leftover food.

Framework has been supported by the club over a number of years and was its official charity partner last season.

description: Nottingham Forest FC won praise for the 'very nice gesture' to local homeless charity Framework.
